item.title: Hubspot's new, modern Asia Pacific headquarters in Singapore is designed with Millennials in mind
item.description: Source: HubSpot. Pictured at the official opening ceremony, from left: Jeetu Mahtani and JD Sherman. HubSpot has officially launched its Singapore office and revealed plans to add 150 employees to its Singapore-based team over the next three years. Currently, HubSpot Singapore has 30 employees. The Singapore office, warmly referred to as SingSpot, joins the Sydney, Australia office as HubSpot’s second location in the Asia Pacific region and will serve as the company’s Asia Pacific headquarters.

item.title: The 5-Min Video Challenge has been introduced by the Singtel Group
item.description: Source: The 5-Min Video Challenge website. Invitation to enter the local rounds. Singtel Group launched The 5-Min Video Challenge to promote creative content across its global markets. The competition is a collaborative effort among Singtel’s associates, including Optus, AIS, Airtel, Globe, and Telkomsel. Winning videos will be shared with over 600 million customers within the Singtel Group. Content creation is a key element of the Group’s strategy for customer engagement in a world where mobile devices are everywhere and demand for online video entertainment is high.

item.title: In May 2015, SilkAir will begin operating flights to Cairns, Australia
item.description: SilkAir, the regional subsidiary of Singapore Airlines, will begin offering direct flights between Singapore and Cairns, Queensland, Australia, starting May 30, 2015, pending regulatory approval. Cairns will be the airline’s second Australian destination after Darwin, which launched in March 2012. SilkAir intends to operate the Cairns route three times a week on Mondays, Thursdays, and Saturdays, through circular routings with Darwin. The inaugural flight and subsequent Saturday flights will depart Singapore for Cairns non-stop, returning to Singapore via Darwin.
